programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
A special edition looking at the police dog teams in the Cleveland and Durham specialist operations unit. Cameras observe the highly trained animals and their handlers in training and in action as the documentary reveals the endearing bonds the hounds develop with their masters. Drawing on new stories as well as archive footage, this programme showcases the vital role the dog unit plays in collaring criminals within the region
S09E11

programme.title: Guns at Batasi (1964)
programme.desc: Rebels besiege the headquarters of a British battalion garrisoned in Africa, enraged by the officers' refusal to give up a prisoner. Meanwhile, the sergeant major struggles to maintain order in his increasingly tense surroundings. Drama, starring Richard Attenborough, Jack Hawkins, Flora Robson and Mia Farrow

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc:

programme.title: Tumbleweed (1953)
programme.desc: A scout visits a Native American tribe to negotiate safe passage for a wagon train, but while he is away, the settlers are attacked and killed. He is falsely accused of leaving them to die and sentenced to hang, but breaks out of jail and tries to clear his name by bringing the culprits to justice. Western, starring Audie Murphy and Lori Nelson

programme.desc:
While targeting cross-border thieves and fraudsters, officers are on the hunt for a car suspected of being used in supermarket thefts in a neighbouring county, while another intelligence-led operation identifies a car that is thought to be linked to drug dealing in North Yorkshire. In Scarborough, number plate recognition cameras identify a suspected stolen car, but when police attempt to pull it over, the car speeds off - and the chase is on. Jamie Theakston presents

programme.desc:

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc:
Traffic Cops: Motorbike Mayhem: Officers pursue a 15-year-old driving a stolen Audi at 140mph down the M62, and track the theft of a VW Golf using automatic number-plate recognition cameras. Plus, police discover a boot full of stolen goods while attending the scene of a serious traffic accident. Jamie Theakston presents
S06E08

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Ian Stapley pursues a trail of sparks left by a car thief with a burst front tyre, while Jacko heads up the firearms team as they look for two men seen in possession of a sawn-off shotgun. Shadow the police dog nearly takes a bite of a barricaded burglar and Kev Salter deals with a heroin user who hides her stash in a hard-to-reach place
S11E07

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Kev Salter takes drastic action to stop a vehicle he suspects has class-A drugs on board, while a nasty street fight leads to a Taser being drawn. Mark Shepherd has his work cut out when a late-night pursuit heads off-road, and the arrest of a wanted man leads to drugs and a lethal weapon being discovered
S11E09

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc:
In North Yorkshire, police are out in force on a bank holiday weekend, and a high-speed pursuit ensues after a driver fails to stop and drives at a police officer. In the Dales, there's a special operation under way to crack down on motorists flouting the law, including motorcyclists riding without tax or insurance, and speeding. A biker takes a tumble down a steep embankment after losing control on a bend, somehow miraculously escaping serious injury. Jamie Theakston presents.
S12E15

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Hoppsy goes after a disqualified motorist who hurdles two fences in his attempts to get away, Damo deploys a stinger in a bid to stop a drunk driver and Kev solves the mystery of a car abandoned in a field. Plus, Spike deals with a drug driver with a mouthy girlfriend and Lee has a strange weekend involving a burning car, two inebriated men and a large garden gnome
S11E10

programme.title: Police: Night Shift 999
programme.desc:
PCs Hayes and Fox are called to a suspected fight, but not all is at it seems and they end up trying to get to the bottom of an alleged drug deal gone wrong. Officers Wells and Bace deal with a lovers' spat spinning out of control and need to decide the best course of action to protect everyone, but it's not going to go down very well with either partner
S02E04

programme.title: Police: Hour of Duty
programme.desc:
999: Police Hour of Duty: Derbyshire policeofficers prepare to raid the address of a suspected drug dealer with links to an organised crime group, but they have limited intel as to who might be inside the property. At Comms HQ it is a hectic night and at 9.10pm a woman calls 999 reporting that her brother is threatening to slit his wrists
S02E01

programme.title: Frontline Police 24/7
programme.desc:

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
999: Criminals: Caught on Camera: Documentary in which journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. Here he exposes the rise in ram raids across the UK, with footage of two masked men using a 4x4 to pull the front off a cash machine at the University of East Anglia in Norwich. Nick also shows how detectives used laser-scanning technology to recreate a crime scene and close in on a gang that terrorised West Yorkshire pub owners in 2013
S03E01

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
999: Criminals Caught On Camera: Journalist Nick Wallis reveals how police use CCTV in the war against knife crime. In Exeter, a woman comes home to find her boyfriend has been stabbed several times. When he dies on the way to hospital, a murder team is assembled - and the programme reveals how 999 calls, interviews and CCTV footage help solve the horrific case. Meanwhile, in St Helens a camera operator spots an agitated man brandishing a blade and must give a running commentary until armed police arrive
S03E02

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: 12/04/2023: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc:
An ice pick found on the roof of a pub brings a murderer to justice and an anonymous letter informs police of a man who is storing and making guns
S03E13

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc:
Animal Park Summer: The keepers try a new strategy to get the koalas mating, pairing up two couples into separate enclosures. But aggression soon threatens the breeding programme
S2021E13

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc:
A pretty cottage in New Mills in Powys, a bungalow in Bilston in the West Midlands, and an end-terrace with holiday-let potential in Norfolk's Great Yarmouth are sold at auction. The developers have set budgets, but have to re-evaluate when faced with soaring building material costs
S25E52

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc:
Newbury 28: Natasha Raskin Sharp is joined by two teams led by experts Charles Hanson and David Harper at an antiques fair in Newbury, Berkshire. The presenter also has a chat with Tim Weeks about the collectable toy market
S54E19

programme.title: BBC News at One
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc:
Angela Rippon, Julia Somerville and Gloria Hunniford report on the double booking nightmare that put a real dampener on the holidays of two families. Plus, the driver whose whose car was left damaged by an airport meet-and-greet service
S11E09

programme.title: Virtually Home
programme.desc:
A couple in Perthshire call on the help of interior designer Russell Sage for advice on how to inject some life into their blank canvas of a living room
S01E08

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc:
Wiltshire: Alistair Appleton helps a buyer with a budget of £260,000 to escape her small flat near Heathrow for some much needed peace and quiet in the Wiltshire countryside
S23E41

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc:
Nigel Havers presents as five more sellers enter the Bidding Room. First in is Jack with some 1940 stained-glass library dividers followed by Geoff with a racing tricycle. Terri and Natalie bring a chest full of Sindy house furniture and Kevin presents the dealers with an interesting painting linked to a famous artist. Last in is Caroline with a vintage copper milking machine
S04E17

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc:
Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford
S02E08

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc:
Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Ed Gamble
S29E08

programme.title: BBC News at Six
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Alex Scott present the magazine show, with stories of interest from around the UK, plus celebrity guests in the studio

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Trouble arises for Eve and Suki when Nish starts asking questions and things get worse for Stacey when a huge electricity bill arrives. Sam receives an offer she can't refuse but it means leaving Ricky behind all over again

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Jay Blades welcomes eight year-old Felix into the barn who brings with him a scientific microscope handed down through the generations from his great-grandfather. Cobbler Dean Westmoreland has an appointment with Malcolm who entrusts him with the task of restoring a pair of boots used by his father during his time as a Prisoner of War in the 1940s. Krishna from Hertfordshire is hoping that Will Kirk can repair the swinging bench that has been in her family for over 120 years and Maria brings in a ceramic sculpture made by her mother that is in desperate need of repair
S12E04

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams set off for checkpoint four - the remote outpost of Churchill that is only accessible by a twice-weekly train and where polar bears can outnumber people. One team make their first major mistake of the race trying to get to Calgary - they'll need to make a race-changing decision to get to the train in time. Another pair encounter a family of missionaries who make them question their reasons for running the race. And one contestant gets more than they bargained for when a bear blocks their path to the train, putting their race in jeopardy
S03E04

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: A Believer's Guide To
programme.desc:
Married, Sikh and Wanting a Baby - Love, Faith & Me: After two miscarriages and three years of trying to have a baby, Sarina and Vik are seeking medical help to conceive while also drawing on their Sikh faith and community. Having always wanted children, the couple are hoping their religion will help them through this emotional time
S02E04

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc:
Gordon invites his 11 contenders to Anglesey, north Wales, to test their raw skills and pure talent. After an expert masterclass on seaweed, the teams must precisely identify and harvest samples of the sustainable crop. Up against the tides, they need to traverse the rocks, to prove they can follow instructions. Next, Gordon tests the contenders' ability to run a business in Wales' glorious 'Little Italy' by the sea, Portmeirion. He asks the teams to create and sell pizzas to locals and tourists - whichever team takes the most money wins. Finally, it's crunch-time as the contenders come face to face with the acerbic chef
S02E02

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc:
How the discovery of a car buried deep within a scrapper's yard proved the key to unlocking the riddle of who was responsible for a suspected gangland shooting at a secluded location. Plus, how tracking a car wash owner's phone connected him to modern-day slavery. Narrated by Chuku Modu
S03E14

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc:
Animal Park Summer: One of the park's favourite couples, armadillos Preston and Polly, are due to be reunited to have another litter. However the keepers make a worrying discovery - Polly is bleeding and they need to figure out what's making her sick. Presented by Kate Humble and Ben Fogle
S2021E14

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc:
Tommy Walsh heads to Stockport, Greater Manchester, to see a two-bed mid-terrace with a considerable damp problem. Martin Roberts is just outside Stoke-on-Trent, where even getting over the threshold of a two-bed mid-terrace is ill-advised. The programme also revisits Milton in Staffordshire, where in 2021 Dion Dublin saw a mixed residential and commercial auction lot
S26E14

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc:
Cheshire 7: Caroline Hawley and Danny Sebastian go antique hunting with two teams at the Royal Cheshire Showground, while presenter Eric Knowles heads to Knutsford's penny farthing museum
S58E05

programme.title: BBC News at One
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc:
A look at how one switch of the visa rules left many with their trips hanging in the balance, and the holidaymakers refused travel when their passports were perfectly valid. Plus, Simon Calder shares his best budget breaks
S11E07

programme.title: Virtually Home
programme.desc:
A mother of a young toddler calls on the help of interior designer Karen Livingstone Welstead and the Virtual Reality studio for advice on how to breath some life and vibrancy into a dull dining space. She has her heart set on it being geared primarily towards her young son, with several bold ideas about how it will look, whereas her best friend thinks a more mature, adult orientated space is perhaps more suitable
S01E09

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc:
Cotswolds: Alistair Appleton guides a pair of budding entrepreneurs who want to escape to the Cotswolds. They have a generous £900,000 to play with, but the property must have the potential to develop a boutique country holiday let. Alistair also spends an exhilarating day at the University of Bath as he launches himself on to the UK's only bobsleigh and skeleton push-start track
S21E10

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc:
Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers battle each other to buy items brought in by the public. Stunt man David turns up with the 1976 toy that inspired his career. His Evel Knievel doll and Stunt World canyon jump is both complete and rare, and he hopes to use its nostalgic qualities to help him leap towards a stellar sale. Ashley appears with a hand-painted 6ft-long tuna that he wants to sell so he can buy a fibreglass gorilla. Michelle presents a mid-20th century chair linked to famous designer Ingmar Relling, which she bought from a junk shop for £15
S04E18

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc:
Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford
S03E09

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc:
Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Ed Gamble
S29E09

programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: 13/04/2023: Alex Jones co-hosts the live magazine show, featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Drastic times call for drastic measures for Stacey as the bills pile high, and Nish quizzes Suki about her time with Eve in Leeds. Amy is in trouble at home when she is caught trying to steal booze from Peggy's

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc:
Investors Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sara Davies and Steven Bartlett face another selection of hopeful entrepreneurs. A duo offering activity-packed weekend breaks for adults turn one of the Dragons into an unhappy camper. Vegan handbags with an X-rated twist raise eyebrows in the Den, the creators of a new home delivery app for shoppers strive to bag a deal and a Lancashire couple behind a range of homemade soups and stews try to warm hearts as well as stomachs. Presented by Evan Davis
S19E03

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc:
Businesses need to adapt to different markets, so with this in mind Gordon gathers the contenders in Manchester to face their next challenges. He begins by asking them to run a 'Bottomless Brunch', hosted by some of the UK's best drag queens. He next sets out to discover who knows the fitness food market, tasking them to master product development, marketing and design. They then face a relentless Q&A from industry greats, including Olympic champion boxer Nicola Adams. Finally, it's the biggest test of all, as Gordon himself grills the contenders on their performance
S02E03

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Stacey Dooley: Ready for War?
programme.desc: Stacey Dooley follows a group of Ukrainian civilians as they arrive in the UK for five weeks of intensive army training before deployment to the frontline fighting against Russia. Among the group is florist and gardener Mykola who wants to join his family members on the frontline and fight towards victory so he can marry his girlfriend. For Pasha, a welder who was living abroad when the invasion began, he fears going into battle means never seeing his parents again

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc:
The Unseen Bits - 1: Material from the comedy panel show, not originally shown in the series 16 episodes. Hosted by Rob Brydon, with team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack joined by celebrity guests including Bob Mortimer, Shirley Ballas, Josie Gibson, Chris McCausland, Bez, Motsi Mabuse, Shazia Mirza, Steve Pemberton, Munya Chawawa, Alice Roberts, Snoochie Shy, Chizzy Akudolu, Simon Gregson, Henning Wehn, Jayde Adams, Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen, Ellie Simmonds and Mist
S16E10

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc:
How a few tiny specks of grey paint help to solve not one, but two, brutal axe murders. Plus, how a bungling burglar was caught when his DNA is discovered on a rock used to smash a window. Narrated by Chuku Modu
S03E15

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc:
Animal Park Summer: Thorn the giraffe is having problems with his hooves, but for the vet to get close enough to fix them he needs to be within kicking distance of the giant animal. Elsewhere in the park, another team of vets prepares to perform a procedure on a pair of male reindeer. Presented by Kate Humble and Ben Fogle

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc:
The development progress of properties in Burnley and Lowestoft, as well as a Shropshire cottage that Martin Roberts has fallen in love with

programme.title: Bargain Hunt

Detling 8: Antiques experts Nick Hall and Tim Weeks assist the red and blue teams as they shop for bargains in Detling, Kent. Presenter Caroline Hawley monitors the contest and also visits Bekonscot, the oldest model village in the world
S64E09

Only the best cooks can earn themselves a place in knockout week, so these amateurs need to show real flair and ambition to edge closer to the 2023 trophy

programme.desc:
Wild Britain: The team helps launch the Wild Britain campaign to protect the UK's wildlife. Ellie Harrison and Hamza Yassin join volunteers transforming an old playing field on the Lincolnshire Fens into a wildlife haven. programme.title: Our Changing Planet
programme.desc:
Part one of two. The second year of a seven-year project to save the planet's endangered ecosystems. Chris Packham is in Greenland to learn more about the rate at which snow and ice are melting and retreating in the Arctic. Liz Bonnin returns to California to investigate surprising solutions for the state's wildfire season, and Steve Backshall travels to the Maldives, a country facing significant challenges because of climate change

programme.title: The Repair Shop

Once belonging to his beloved Granny Ethel, Peter hopes metal craftsman Dom can bring the sentimental kitchen curiosity back to life. David Burville takes on the challenge of restoring a Spanish barrel organ known as an organillo. Owner Carolina Urraca is hoping David can breathe new life into the instrument she loved to play when growing up with her grandmother in Spain. Audio specialist tackles the repair of Lorraine McCourt's portable record player from the 1950s. Originally a gift from her father to her mother when they were courting, the precious momento brings back memories of Lorraine's parents dancing to Nat King Cole. Finally, Malcom Jordan from Chippenham brings in a 65 year-old leather document case for Susie Fletcher to repair
S06E12

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Peter Mason from Herefordshire brings an old-fashioned ice cream maker into the Repair Shop. Once belonging to his beloved Granny Ethel, Peter hopes metal craftsman Dom can bring the sentimental kitchen curiosity back to life. David Burville takes on the challenge of restoring a Spanish barrel organ known as an organillo. Owner Carolina Urraca is hoping David can breathe new life into the instrument she loved to play when growing up with her grandmother in Spain. Audio specialist tackles the repair of Lorraine McCourt's portable record player from the 1950s. Originally a gift from her father to her mother when they were courting, the precious momento brings back memories of Lorraine's parents dancing to Nat King Cole. Finally, Malcom Jordan from Chippenham brings in a 65 year-old leather document case for Susie Fletcher to repair
S06E12

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Peter Mason from Herefordshire brings an old-fashioned ice cream maker into the Repair Shop. Once belonging to his beloved Granny Ethel, Peter hopes metal craftsman Dom can bring the sentimental kitchen curiosity back to life. David Burville takes on the challenge of restoring a Spanish barrel organ known as an organillo. Owner Carolina Urraca is hoping David can breathe new life into the instrument she loved to play when growing up with her grandmother in Spain. Audio specialist tackles the repair of Lorraine McCourt's portable record player from the 1950s. Originally a gift from her father to her mother when they were courting, the precious momento brings back memories of Lorraine's parents dancing to Nat King Cole. Finally, Malcom Jordan from Chippenham brings in a 65 year-old leather document case for Susie Fletcher to repair
S06E12

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

David Burville takes on the challenge of restoring a Spanish barrel organ known as an organillo. Owner Carolina Urraca is hoping David can breathe new life into the instrument she loved to play when growing up with her grandmother in Spain. Audio specialist tackles the repair of Lorraine McCourt's portable record player from the 1950s. Originally a gift from her father to her mother when they were courting, the precious momento brings back memories of Lorraine's parents dancing to Nat King Cole. programme.desc:

The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring West Ham United v Arsenal at London Stadium and Nottingham Forest v Manchester United at the City Ground. programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Peter Mason from Herefordshire brings an old-fashioned ice cream maker into the Repair Shop. Once belonging to his beloved Granny Ethel, Peter hopes metal craftsman Dom can bring the sentimental kitchen curiosity back to life. David Burville takes on the challenge of restoring a Spanish barrel organ known as an organillo. Owner Carolina Urraca is hoping David can breathe new life into the instrument she loved to play when growing up with her grandmother in Spain. Audio specialist tackles the repair of Lorraine McCourt's portable record player from the 1950s. Originally a gift from her father to her mother when they were courting, the precious momento brings back memories of Lorraine's parents dancing to Nat King Cole. Finally, Malcom Jordan from Chippenham brings in a 65 year-old leather document case for Susie Fletcher to repair
S06E12

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

Finally, it's the biggest test of all, as Gordon himself grills the contenders on their performance

A duo offering activity-packed weekend breaks for adults turn one of the Dragons into an unhappy camper. Vegan handbags with an X-rated twist raise eyebrows in the Den, the creators of a new home delivery app for shoppers strive to bag a deal and a Lancashire couple behind a range of homemade soups and stews try to warm hearts as well as stomachs. Presented by Evan Davis
S19E03

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc:
Businesses need to adapt to different markets, so with this in mind Gordon gathers the contenders in Manchester to face their next challenges. He begins by asking them to run a 'Bottomless Brunch', hosted by some of the UK's best drag queens. He next sets out to discover who knows the fitness food market, tasking them to master product development, marketing and design. They then face a relentless Q&A from industry greats, including Olympic champion boxer Nicola Adams. Finally, it's the biggest test of all, as Gordon himself grills the contenders on their performance
S02E03

programme.desc: Stacey Dooley follows a group of Ukrainian civilians as they arrive in the UK for five weeks of intensive army training before deployment to the frontline fighting against Russia. Among the group is florist and gardener Mykola who wants to join his family members on the frontline and fight towards victory so he can marry his girlfriend. For Pasha, a welder who was living abroad when the invasion began, he fears going into battle means never seeing his parents again

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Peter Mason from Herefordshire brings an old-fashioned ice cream maker into the Repair Shop. Once belonging to his beloved Granny Ethel, Peter hopes metal craftsman Dom can bring the sentimental kitchen curiosity back to life. David Burville takes on the challenge of restoring a Spanish barrel organ known as an organillo. Owner Carolina Urraca is hoping David can breathe new life into the instrument she loved to play when growing up with her grandmother in Spain. Audio specialist tackles the repair of Lorraine McCourt's portable record player from the 1950s. Originally a gift from her father to her mother when they were courting, the precious momento brings back memories of Lorraine's parents dancing to Nat King Cole. Finally, Malcom Jordan from Chippenham brings in a 65 year-old leather document case for Susie Fletcher to repair
S06E12

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

Chris Packham is in Greenland to learn more about the rate at which snow and ice are melting and retreating in the Arctic. Liz Bonnin returns to California to investigate surprising solutions for the state's wildfire season, and Steve Backshall travels to the Maldives, a country facing significant challenges because of climate change

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Peter Mason from Herefordshire brings an old-fashioned ice cream maker into the Repair Shop. Once belonging to his beloved Granny Ethel, Peter hopes metal craftsman Dom can bring the sentimental kitchen curiosity back to life. David Burville takes on the challenge of restoring a Spanish barrel organ known as an organillo. Owner Carolina Urraca is hoping David can breathe new life into the instrument she loved to play when growing up with her grandmother in Spain. Audio specialist tackles the repair of Lorraine McCourt's portable record player from the 1950s. Originally a gift from her father to her mother when they were courting, the precious momento brings back memories of Lorraine's parents dancing to Nat King Cole. Finally, Malcom Jordan from Chippenham brings in a 65 year-old leather document case for Susie Fletcher to repair
S06E12

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Trouble arises for Eve and Suki when Nish starts asking questions and things get worse for Stacey when a huge electricity bill arrives. Sam receives an offer she can't refuse but it means leaving Ricky behind all over again

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Jay Blades welcomes eight year-old Felix into the barn who brings with him a scientific microscope handed down through the generations from his great-grandfather. Cobbler Dean Westmoreland has an appointment with Malcolm who entrusts him with the task of restoring a pair of boots used by his father during his time as a Prisoner of War in the 1940s. Krishna from Hertfordshire is hoping that Will Kirk can repair the swinging bench that has been in her family for over 120 years and Maria brings in a ceramic sculpture made by her mother that is in desperate need of repair
S12E04

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams set off for checkpoint four - the remote outpost of Churchill that is only accessible by a twice-weekly train and where polar bears can outnumber people. One team make their first major mistake of the race trying to get to Calgary - they'll need to make a race-changing decision to get to the train in time. Another pair encounter a family of missionaries who make them question their reasons for running the race. And one contestant gets more than they bargained for when a bear blocks their path to the train, putting their race in jeopardy
S03E04

programme.title: A Believer's Guide To
programme.desc:
Married, Sikh and Wanting a Baby - Love, Faith & Me: After two miscarriages and three years of trying to have a baby, Sarina and Vik are seeking medical help to conceive while also drawing on their Sikh faith and community. Having always wanted children, the couple are hoping their religion will help them through this emotional time
S02E04

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc:
Gordon invites his 11 contenders to Anglesey, north Wales, to test their raw skills and pure talent. After an expert masterclass on seaweed, the teams must precisely identify and harvest samples of the sustainable crop. Up against the tides, they need to traverse the rocks, to prove they can follow instructions. Next, Gordon tests the contenders' ability to run a business in Wales' glorious 'Little Italy' by the sea, Portmeirion. He asks the teams to create and sell pizzas to locals and tourists - whichever team takes the most money wins. Finally, it's crunch-time as the contenders come face to face with the acerbic chef
S02E02

Vegan handbags with an X-rated twist raise eyebrows in the Den, the creators of a new home delivery app for shoppers strive to bag a deal and a Lancashire couple behind a range of homemade soups and stews try to warm hearts as well as stomachs. programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc:

He next sets out to discover who knows the fitness food market, tasking them to master product development, marketing and design. They then face a relentless Q&A from industry greats, including Olympic champion boxer Nicola Adams. Finally, it's the biggest test of all, as Gordon himself grills the contenders on their performance

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Peter Mason from Herefordshire brings an old-fashioned ice cream maker into the Repair Shop. Once belonging to his beloved Granny Ethel, Peter hopes metal craftsman Dom can bring the sentimental kitchen curiosity back to life. David Burville takes on the challenge of restoring a Spanish barrel organ known as an organillo. Owner Carolina Urraca is hoping David can breathe new life into the instrument she loved to play when growing up with her grandmother in Spain. Audio specialist tackles the repair of Lorraine McCourt's portable record player from the 1950s. Originally a gift from her father to her mother when they were courting, the precious momento brings back memories of Lorraine's parents dancing to Nat King Cole. Finally, Malcom Jordan from Chippenham brings in a 65 year-old leather document case for Susie Fletcher to repair
S06E12

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

Once belonging to his beloved Granny Ethel, Peter hopes metal craftsman Dom can bring the sentimental kitchen curiosity back to life. David Burville takes on the challenge of restoring a Spanish barrel organ known as an organillo. Owner Carolina Urraca is hoping David can breathe new life into the instrument she loved to play when growing up with her grandmother in Spain. Audio specialist tackles the repair of Lorraine McCourt's portable record player from the 1950s. Originally a gift from her father to her mother when they were courting, the precious momento brings back memories of Lorraine's parents dancing to Nat King Cole. Finally, Malcom Jordan from Chippenham brings in a 65 year-old leather document case for Susie Fletcher to repair

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Peter Mason from Herefordshire brings an old-fashioned ice cream maker into the Repair Shop. Once belonging to his beloved Granny Ethel, Peter hopes metal craftsman Dom can bring the sentimental kitchen curiosity back to life. David Burville takes on the challenge of restoring a Spanish barrel organ known as an organillo. Owner Carolina Urraca is hoping David can breathe new life into the instrument she loved to play when growing up with her grandmother in Spain. Audio specialist tackles the repair of Lorraine McCourt's portable record player from the 1950s. Originally a gift from her father to her mother when they were courting, the precious momento brings back memories of Lorraine's parents dancing to Nat King Cole. Finally, Malcom Jordan from Chippenham brings in a 65 year-old leather document case for Susie Fletcher to repair
S06E12

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Peter Mason from Herefordshire brings an old-fashioned ice cream maker into the Repair Shop. Once belonging to his beloved Granny Ethel, Peter hopes metal craftsman Dom can bring the sentimental kitchen curiosity back to life. David Burville takes on the challenge of restoring a Spanish barrel organ known as an organillo. Owner Carolina Urraca is hoping David can breathe new life into the instrument she loved to play when growing up with her grandmother in Spain. Audio specialist tackles the repair of Lorraine McCourt's portable record player from the 1950s. Originally a gift from her father to her mother when they were courting, the precious momento brings back memories of Lorraine's parents dancing to Nat King Cole. Finally, Malcom Jordan from Chippenham brings in a 65 year-old leather document case for Susie Fletcher to repair
S06E12

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.desc:

Once belonging to his beloved Granny Ethel, Peter hopes metal craftsman Dom can bring the sentimental kitchen curiosity back to life. David Burville takes on the challenge of restoring a Spanish barrel organ known as an organillo. Owner Carolina Urraca is hoping David can breathe new life into the instrument she loved to play when growing up with her grandmother in Spain. Audio specialist tackles the repair of Lorraine McCourt's portable record player from the 1950s. Originally a gift from her father to her mother when they were courting, the precious momento brings back memories of Lorraine's parents dancing to Nat King Cole. Finally, Malcom Jordan from Chippenham brings in a 65 year-old leather document case for Susie Fletcher to repair

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home

programme.desc:

He begins by asking them to run a 'Bottomless Brunch', hosted by some of the UK's best drag queens. programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Peter Mason from Herefordshire brings an old-fashioned ice cream maker into the Repair Shop. Once belonging to his beloved Granny Ethel, Peter hopes metal craftsman Dom can bring the sentimental kitchen curiosity back to life. David Burville takes on the challenge of restoring a Spanish barrel organ known as an organillo. Owner Carolina Urraca is hoping David can breathe new life into the instrument she loved to play when growing up with her grandmother in Spain. Audio specialist tackles the repair of Lorraine McCourt's portable record player from the 1950s. Originally a gift from her father to her mother when they were courting, the precious momento brings back memories of Lorraine's parents dancing to Nat King Cole. Finally, Malcom Jordan from Chippenham brings in a 65 year-old leather document case for Susie Fletcher to repair
S06E12

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

Vegan handbags with an X-rated twist raise eyebrows in the Den, the creators of a new home delivery app for shoppers strive to bag a deal and a Lancashire couple behind a range of homemade soups and stews try to warm hearts as well as stomachs. Presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc:
Businesses need to adapt to different markets, so with this in mind Gordon gathers the contenders in Manchester to face their next challenges. He begins by asking them to run a 'Bottomless Brunch', hosted by some of the UK's best drag queens. He next sets out to discover who knows the fitness food market, tasking them to master product development, marketing and design. They then face a relentless Q&A from industry greats, including Olympic champion boxer Nicola Adams. Finally, it's the biggest test of all, as Gordon himself grills the contenders on their performance

programme.desc: Stacey Dooley follows a group of Ukrainian civilians as they arrive in the UK for five weeks of intensive army training before deployment to the frontline fighting against Russia. Among the group is florist and gardener Mykola who wants to join his family members on the frontline and fight towards victory so he can marry his girlfriend. For Pasha, a welder who was living abroad when the invasion began, he fears going into battle means never seeing his parents again

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Peter Mason from Herefordshire brings an old-fashioned ice cream maker into the Repair Shop. Once belonging to his beloved Granny Ethel, Peter hopes metal craftsman Dom can bring the sentimental kitchen curiosity back to life. David Burville takes on the challenge of restoring a Spanish barrel organ known as an organillo. Owner Carolina Urraca is hoping David can breathe new life into the instrument she loved to play when growing up with her grandmother in Spain. Audio specialist tackles the repair of Lorraine McCourt's portable record player from the 1950s. Originally a gift from her father to her mother when they were courting, the precious momento brings back memories of Lorraine's parents dancing to Nat King Cole. Finally, Malcom Jordan from Chippenham brings in a 65 year-old leather document case for Susie Fletcher to repair
S06E12

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.desc:

Chris Packham is in Greenland to learn more about the rate at which snow and ice are melting and retreating in the Arctic. Liz Bonnin returns to California to investigate surprising solutions for the state's wildfire season, and Steve Backshall travels to the Maldives, a country facing significant challenges because of climate change

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Peter Mason from Herefordshire brings an old-fashioned ice cream maker into the Repair Shop. Once belonging to his beloved Granny Ethel, Peter hopes metal craftsman Dom can bring the sentimental kitchen curiosity back to life. David Burville takes on the challenge of restoring a Spanish barrel organ known as an organillo. Owner Carolina Urraca is hoping David can breathe new life into the instrument she loved to play when growing up with her grandmother in Spain. Audio specialist tackles the repair of Lorraine McCourt's portable record player from the 1950s. Originally a gift from her father to her mother when they were courting, the precious momento brings back memories of Lorraine's parents dancing to Nat King Cole. Finally, Malcom Jordan from Chippenham brings in a 65 year-old leather document case for Susie Fletcher to repair
S06E12

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Jay Blades welcomes eight year-old Felix into the barn who brings with him a scientific microscope handed down through the generations from his great-grandfather. Cobbler Dean Westmoreland has an appointment with Malcolm who entrusts him with the task of restoring a pair of boots used by his father during his time as a Prisoner of War in the 1940s. Krishna from Hertfordshire is hoping that Will Kirk can repair the swinging bench that has been in her family for over 120 years and Maria brings in a ceramic sculpture made by her mother that is in desperate need of repair
S12E04

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams set off for checkpoint four - the remote outpost of Churchill that is only accessible by a twice-weekly train and where polar bears can outnumber people. One team make their first major mistake of the race trying to get to Calgary - they'll need to make a race-changing decision to get to the train in time. Another pair encounter a family of missionaries who make them question their reasons for running the race. And one contestant gets more than they bargained for when a bear blocks their path to the train, putting their race in jeopardy
S03E04

programme.title: A Believer's Guide To
programme.desc:
Married, Sikh and Wanting a Baby - Love, Faith & Me: After two miscarriages and three years of trying to have a baby, Sarina and Vik are seeking medical help to conceive while also drawing on their Sikh faith and community. Having always wanted children, the couple are hoping their religion will help them through this emotional time
S02E04

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc:
Gordon invites his 11 contenders to Anglesey, north Wales, to test their raw skills and pure talent. After an expert masterclass on seaweed, the teams must precisely identify and harvest samples of the sustainable crop. Up against the tides, they need to traverse the rocks, to prove they can follow instructions. Next, Gordon tests the contenders' ability to run a business in Wales' glorious 'Little Italy' by the sea, Portmeirion. He asks the teams to create and sell pizzas to locals and tourists - whichever team takes the most money wins. Finally, it's crunch-time as the contenders come face to face with the acerbic chef
S02E02

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Peter Mason from Herefordshire brings an old-fashioned ice cream maker into the Repair Shop. Once belonging to his beloved Granny Ethel, Peter hopes metal craftsman Dom can bring the sentimental kitchen curiosity back to life. David Burville takes on the challenge of restoring a Spanish barrel organ known as an organillo. Owner Carolina Urraca is hoping David can breathe new life into the instrument she loved to play when growing up with her grandmother in Spain. Audio specialist tackles the repair of Lorraine McCourt's portable record player from the 1950s. Originally a gift from her father to her mother when they were courting, the precious momento brings back memories of Lorraine's parents dancing to Nat King Cole. Finally, Malcom Jordan from Chippenham brings in a 65 year-old leather document case for Susie Fletcher to repair
S06E12

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.title: BBC 100 Women In Conversation
programme.desc:
Priyanka Chopra Jonas: Priyanka Chopra Jonas never dreamt of becoming famous, but then she won the 2000 Miss World pageant, which provided a 'small-town girl' with a springboard for an international career. But she says she was getting paid 10% of her male co-actor's salary while starring in Bollywood movies, and it's been only during her most recent acting engagement in Hollywood that she has seen the gender pay gap closing for her. In an interview with BBC 100 Women's Yogita Limaye, the Indian actress and producer speaks about her experience with pay parity, body shaming and the pressure social media can bring.
S01E03

programme.desc: Click is in the capital of South Korea, which has more robots per head of population than any other country. programme.title: Hiplife: The Sound of Ghana : Hiplife Rewind
programme.desc: The story of Ghana’s music genre through personal accounts of key artists and creatives in the scene from past and present. Featuring pioneering icons such as Reggie Rockstone, Gyedu-Blay Ambolley, and film-maker Abraham Ohene–Djan, as well as rich historical archive of Highlife music and Ghanaian life, reporter Akwasi Sarpong heads through the genre’s early musical and cultural influences.

programme.title: We Are England
programme.desc: Ruben and Lewis have dreamt of having a place on the Formula 1 circuit for as long as they can remember. They’ve been racing since the age of four and have won hundreds of trophies between them. This year, they are stepping up a gear and entering a race that could make or break their careers. Breaking into motorsports isn't easy. Motor racing is an exceptionally expensive sport, with annual costs in the tens of thousands just for go-karting – for cars, the sky is the limit. It is also notably lacking in diversity. Those financial and cultural barriers often stand in the way of new drivers coming onto the track. But Ruben and Lewis’s fathers are dedicated to helping their sons achieve their dreams. They, and their families, are prepared to sacrifice everything to help them make it. Now, they are stepping up from racing in go-karts to securing seats in professional race cars. It’s time for Ruben and Lewis to deliver on track, get themselves noticed and do their dads proud. Can these dete

programme.title: BBC 100 Women In Conversation
programme.desc:
Priyanka Chopra Jonas: Priyanka Chopra Jonas never dreamt of becoming famous, but then she won the 2000 Miss World pageant, which provided a 'small-town girl' with a springboard for an international career. But she says she was getting paid 10% of her male co-actor's salary while starring in Bollywood movies, and it's been only during her most recent acting engagement in Hollywood that she has seen the gender pay gap closing for her. In an interview with BBC 100 Women's Yogita Limaye, the Indian actress and producer speaks about her experience with pay parity, body shaming and the pressure social media can bring.
S01E03

programme.desc: Click is in the capital of South Korea, which has more robots per head of population than any other country. programme.title: Hiplife: The Sound of Ghana : Hiplife Rewind
programme.desc: The story of Ghana’s music genre through personal accounts of key artists and creatives in the scene from past and present. programme.desc: Ruben and Lewis have dreamt of having a place on the Formula 1 circuit for as long as they can remember. They’ve been racing since the age of four and have won hundreds of trophies between them. This year, they are stepping up a gear and entering a race that could make or break their careers. Breaking into motorsports isn't easy. Motor racing is an exceptionally expensive sport, with annual costs in the tens of thousands just for go-karting – for cars, the sky is the limit. It is also notably lacking in diversity. Those financial and cultural barriers often stand in the way of new drivers coming onto the track. But Ruben and Lewis’s fathers are dedicated to helping their sons achieve their dreams. They, and their families, are prepared to sacrifice everything to help them make it. Now, they are stepping up from racing in go-karts to securing seats in professional race cars. It’s time for Ruben and Lewis to deliver on track, get themselves noticed and do their dads proud. programme.title: BBC 100 Women In Conversation
programme.desc:
Priyanka Chopra Jonas: Priyanka Chopra Jonas never dreamt of becoming famous, but then she won the 2000 Miss World pageant, which provided a 'small-town girl' with a springboard for an international career. But she says she was getting paid 10% of her male co-actor's salary while starring in Bollywood movies, and it's been only during her most recent acting engagement in Hollywood that she has seen the gender pay gap closing for her. In an interview with BBC 100 Women's Yogita Limaye, the Indian actress and producer speaks about her experience with pay parity, body shaming and the pressure social media can bring.
S01E03

programme.title: We Are England
programme.desc: Ruben and Lewis have dreamt of having a place on the Formula 1 circuit for as long as they can remember. They’ve been racing since the age of four and have won hundreds of trophies between them. This year, they are stepping up a gear and entering a race that could make or break their careers. Breaking into motorsports isn't easy. Motor racing is an exceptionally expensive sport, with annual costs in the tens of thousands just for go-karting – for cars, the sky is the limit. It is also notably lacking in diversity. Those financial and cultural barriers often stand in the way of new drivers coming onto the track. But Ruben and Lewis’s fathers are dedicated to helping their sons achieve their dreams. They, and their families, are prepared to sacrifice everything to help them make it. Now, they are stepping up from racing in go-karts to securing seats in professional race cars. It’s time for Ruben and Lewis to deliver on track, get themselves noticed and do their dads proud. Can these dete

programme.title: BBC 100 Women In Conversation
programme.desc:
Priyanka Chopra Jonas: Priyanka Chopra Jonas never dreamt of becoming famous, but then she won the 2000 Miss World pageant, which provided a 'small-town girl' with a springboard for an international career. But she says she was getting paid 10% of her male co-actor's salary while starring in Bollywood movies, and it's been only during her most recent acting engagement in Hollywood that she has seen the gender pay gap closing for her. In an interview with BBC 100 Women's Yogita Limaye, the Indian actress and producer speaks about her experience with pay parity, body shaming and the pressure social media can bring.
S01E03
